column1: When we return, Americans this weekend are marching against the war and in support of the troops.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Here in the United States this weekend just as they did last weekend, anti-war protesters taking to the street.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-25" type="COUNTRY"

column1: In Los Angeles , the International Black Coalition for Peace and Justice is sponsoring a rally for peace today.
column2: Los Angeles PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1663328" id="Pl-26" latLong="34.052°N 118.243°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: In the meantime further north in California , San Francisco is the setting today for a rally aimed at boosting the moral of the American troops in the Persian Gulf region.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",California PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780778" id="Pl-27" latLong="37.250°N 119.750°W" mod="N" state="US-CA" type="CIVIL",San Francisco PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:278593" id="Pl-31" latLong="37.775°N 122.418°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: CNN's Rusty Dornin is with us from San Francisco . Rusty, what sort of crowd is showing up there?
column2: San Francisco PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:278593" id="Pl-31" latLong="37.775°N 122.418°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: Of course this is the home of the anti- war demonstrations stemming back to the Vietnam War but there are close to between 500 and 1,000 people.
column2: Vietnam PLACE country="VN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16266660" id="Pl-35" latLong="16.167°N 107.833°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: You're looking at some of San Francisco 's police department's officers.
column2: San Francisco PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:278593" id="Pl-31" latLong="37.775°N 122.418°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: As I said, the officers did tell me that this is the largest pro-troops demonstration that has ever been in San Francisco since the Vietnam War.
column2: Vietnam PLACE country="VN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16266660" id="Pl-35" latLong="16.167°N 107.833°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",San Francisco PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:278593" id="Pl-31" latLong="37.775°N 122.418°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: As I said, there have been a few verbal exchanges but one of the most enthusiastically received speakers here was Bessam Al-Husaini, an Iraqi American.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He's with the Iraqi American Council.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: How does the Iraqi American Council feel?
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: BESSAM AL-HUSAINI, IRAQI AMERICAN COUNCIL Well the Iraqi American have been waiting for this liberation and they want to get rid of Saddam so bad and they will have to take it the way it's been offered to us.
column2: AMERICAN PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-38" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",IRAQI PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: AL-HUSAINI We get reports that these civilians especially in the (INAUDIBLE) population have been attacked by the Iraqi regime themselves so they can't blame the American and said look what the American doing to us.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He would love to see this and would draw on this emotion from the Arab world and the European country.
column2: country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: DORNIN Now you said you did talk to your family in Baghdad as well and they also are somewhat suspicious of the Americans.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: AL-HUSAINI Well, I mean the Iraqi people have been the primary victim from the whole thing.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It will be attack the Iraqi regime.

column1: CNN's Kevin Sites is in northern Iraq . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KEVIN SITES, CNN CORRESPONDENT This is the road to Kirkuk .

column1: A day ago it was controlled by Iraqi troops and packed with these land mines but now we can drive far enough to see the outskirts of Kirkuk .
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-18" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="TS" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: That's because coalition fighter jets pummeled this Iraqi position on the hills above Chamchamal and Iraqi troops made a hasty retreat.
column2: hills PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-20" type="MTS",Chamchamal PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895613" id="Pl-16" latLong="35.537°N 44.832°E" state="SW" type="PPL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This is what the hilltop looks like now, craters 15 feet deep, busted bunkers and twisted metal, scattered ammunitions and tattered clothing, a helmet, a tube of toothpaste.
column2: hilltop PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-21" type="MTN"

column1: Kurdish Peshmerga fighters took their place.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208909932" id="Pl-12" type="RGN"

column1: They killed a lot of our people in Chamchamal but I feel bad for them too.
column2: Chamchamal PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895613" id="Pl-16" latLong="35.537°N 44.832°E" state="SW" type="PPL"

column1: Some Kurds took advantage of the Iraqi retreat right away.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Although the Iraqis retreated from this area, at dusk they fired what observers say were seven artillery rounds back at their former stronghold creating new fear and potentially new casualties.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Kevin Sites, CNN Chamchamal northern Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF All right and when we return, waiting here on the home front, a very special reunion between a Marine and his wife.

column2: California PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780778" id="Pl-22" latLong="37.250°N 119.750°W" state="CA" type="CIVIL"

column1: War in Iraq

column1: A few moments ago, out on the horizon, not very far ahead of the U.S. Army's 3rd Squadron, 7th Cavalry, we heard more than a few explosions.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The U.S. Army's 3rd Squadron, 7th Cavalry has compiled a rather extraordinary record in the past several days.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It was the first unit to cross the Euphrates River and then punch SIGNAL id="S-1" northward SIGNAL to SIGNAL id="S-2" within 60 miles SIGNAL of Baghdad .
column2: Euphrates River PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19251239" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.083°N 43.483°E" type="WATER",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: We've had an absolutely terrific story, pushing forward SIGNAL id="S-3" north SIGNAL toward Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Mostly small arms fire, but the sand storm has enabled the Iraqis to come very close to the road , and if I sound a little nervous, it's because we're in the soft skin vehicle and everybody else is in armor.
column2: Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We'd like to now show you what we call Old Betsy (ph), a re-used, secondhand U.S. Army Humvee that we've been traveling with.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Police say a suicide bomber blew himself up outside this cafe , called The London Cafe , earlier Sunday afternoon.
column2: London PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17398111" id="Pl-20" latLong="51.500°N 0.117°W" predicative="true" state="GB-ENG" type="PPLC",cafe PLACE country="IL" form="NOM" id="Pl-282" type="FAC",Cafe PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" id="Pl-289" type="FAC"

column1: People here tell us the cafe was filled with people enjoying the spring weather.
column2: cafe PLACE country="IL" form="NOM" id="Pl-282" type="FAC"

column1: Dozens, though, injured, including some Israeli soldiers, because according to an eyewitness, he said many soldiers were here also enjoying the spring weather.
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Israeli PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-13" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: WALLACE There had been many terrorist attacks here in Netanya , including the deadliest suicide bombing ever in Israel almost exactly a year ago, March 27, at the Park Hotel during Passover, 29 people killed in that attack.
column2: Park Hotel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" id="Pl-288" type="FAC",Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Netanya PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219140" id="Pl-18" latLong="32.334°N 34.858°E" state="IL-M" type="PPL"

column1: As for this attack, the Palestinian militant group Islamic Jihad is claiming responsibility.
column2: Palestinian PLACE country="PS" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208674239" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="RGN"

column1: According to a leaflet from the group obtained by CNN, the group says the attack was to show the union of Palestinians with the people of Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Palestinian PLACE country="PS" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208674239" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="RGN"

column1: The group is also claiming that Islamic Jihad militants are already inside Iraq to carry out attacks against U.S. and British forces.
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-22" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Israel has been on a heightened state of alert since the start of the U.S. -led war against Iraq .
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And now many Israelis fear they could see more attacks like the one they saw here today as the military campaign against Saddam Hussein continues.
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Israeli PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-13" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: I'm Kelly Wallace, CNN, reporting from Netanyahu , Israel . (END VIDEOTAPE) CROWLEY A baseball legend rallies the troops.

column1: As of an hour or so ago, we got word from the battlefield that U.S. forces were SIGNAL id="S-1" just 15 miles SIGNAL away from the southern edge of Baghdad .
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: The toughest fight, though, may lie ahead in the heart of the Iraqi capital . Pentagon sources say the first phase of the final push into Baghdad is now under way.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="S" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: U.S. -led forces were able to press farther north after defeating Iraqi Republican Guard units at Karbala and Kut (ph).
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA",Kut PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897407" id="Pl-38" latLong="32.498°N 45.829°E" state="IQ-WA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Scenes from Najaf may also be bolstering the troops' spirit.
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-40" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="IQ-NA" type="PPLA"

column1: Iraqis who initially were cautious when U.S. forces arrived in Najaf ended cheering them on, shaking their hands and patting their backs.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-40" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="IQ-NA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: U.S. Army's 7th Cavalry is in the forefront of U.S. troops since they first left Kuwait and crossed directly into the Iraqi desert.
column2: desert PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-42" type="RGN",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Kuwait PLACE country="KW" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19210228" id="Pl-41" latLong="29.500°N 47.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Our Walter Rodgers is embedded with the unit's 3rd Squadron, which is leading the 3rd Infantry Division's march toward the Iraqi capital . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) WALTER RODGERS, CNN CORRESPONDENT Throughout the day, as the U.S. Army 7th Cavalry punched SIGNAL id="S-6" northward SIGNAL in the general direction of Baghdad , we have seen huge convoys of supply troops moving ever northward.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="S" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Indeed, all the arrows on the Army's map seem to be pointing in the direction of the southern suburbs of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Earlier in the day, the 1st Brigade of the 3rd Infantry Division took Karbala with a minimum of fight.
column2: Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: And then the 3rd Brigade of the 3rd Infantry Division secured the town of Karbala . Additionally, the 7th Cavalry has pushed onward in the general direction of Baghdad .
column2: Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Yesterday we were SIGNAL id="S-2" about 50 miles SIGNAL from the southern suburbs of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Iraqi soldiers glad the war is over for them, perhaps 100 at a time.
column2: Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: There were times when the 7th Cavalry itself got into some skirmishes as it pushed forward, again in the direction of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: The Iraqi unit in possession of those guns fired mortars in the direction of the 7th Cavalry.
column2: Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Apache troop opened its tank guns, opened its own mortars, decimated that unit, put it out of existence and probably killed some 20 Iraqis in the process.
column2: Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This as it continues to push ever closer towards the southern suburbs of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Walter Rodgers, CNN, with the U.S. 7th Cavalry in the Iraqi desert . (END VIDEOTAPE) BLITZER And it's a similar story from CNN's Karl Penhaul who is now SIGNAL id="S-3" just miles SIGNAL from the southern outskirts of the Iraqi capital . He's embedded with the U.S. Army's 11th Attack Helicopter Regiment.
column2: desert PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-42" type="RGN",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="S" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KARL PENHAUL, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) The speed as they push to Baghdad seems to have gathered pace overnight and in the course of this morning.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: In fact, it's going much faster than many of the U.S. commanders on the ground predicted.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: PENHAUL Overnight and early this morning, the tanks and Bradley fighting vehicles of the 3rd Infantry Division backed by the Apache attack helicopters of the 11th Aviation Regiment punched through the Republican Guard defenses in and around Karbala .
column2: Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: They were then able to advance SIGNAL id="S-4" far north SIGNAL of that city and, as we speak, U.S. commanders tell me that elements of the 3rd Infantry Division are now literally just a SIGNAL id="S-5" few miles SIGNAL from Baghdad . (END VIDEOTAPE)
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-43" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: Let's get an update now on casualties on Operation Iraqi Freedom.

column1: Britain reports 6 of its troops have been killed by combat, 19 more in nonhostile action and 2 deaths have not been classified.
column2: Britain PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-26" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraq does not report on its military casualties, but Iraqi officials say 420 civilians have been killed and about 4,000 injured.

column1: U.S. Central Command says 4,500 Iraqis have been taken prisoner.

column1: Seven Americans remain prisoners of war in Iraq and 15 Americans are listed as missing in action.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Judy, in the next hour, on our special "WOLF BLITZER REPORTS," I'm going to be speaking live to her older brother who is in the Army, her younger sister who wants to be in the Army, just around the same time as Jessica is going to be arriving at Ramstein , the air base in Germany for some serious medical treatment.
column2: Ramstein PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20024036" id="Pl-27" latLong="49.433°N 7.600°E" state="RP" type="FAC",Germany PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18224345" id="Pl-28" latLong="51.500°N 10.500°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Well, at the Pentagon briefing this afternoon, officials describing several units of the Republican Guard as effectively no longer being a credible fighting force.
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: Let's get the very latest from the Pentagon for the overall war picture as they see it.
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: MILITARY AFFAIRS CORRESPONDENT Well Judy, the Pentagon is beginning to see positive signs that it hadn't seen for awhile.
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: First of all, as we saw just a few moments ago on CNN, the pictures of some of the actual happy Iraqi citizens welcoming U.S. troops, that taking place in Najaf .
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-25" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Also the Pentagon is seeing lighter than expected resistance indicating at least that they may have really seriously degraded those Republican Guard divisions before the U.S. troops arrived, both in Karbala and also in Al Kut .
column2: Al Kut PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897407" id="Pl-23" latLong="32.498°N 45.829°E" state="WA" type="PPLA",Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-21" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="KA" type="PPLA"

column1: But the Pentagon officials stress that as they close in on Baghdad , this becomes the real dangerous part as they enter that so- called red zone where Saddam Hussein is believed to have given his commanders authority to use chemical weapons, and that use of chemical weapons remains a real fear at the Pentagon . (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) MAJOR GENERAL STANLEY MCCHRYSTAL, JOINT CHIEFS, VICE DIR.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: We are not expecting to drive into Baghdad suddenly and seize it in a coup de mains, or anything like that.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Clearly, as we threaten the core of the regime, which Baghdad and Tikrit represent, we believe that the likelihood of them using those weapons goes up.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Tikrit PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16888105" id="Pl-37" latLong="34.597°N 43.677°E" state="SD" type="PPL"

column1: (END VIDEO CLIP) BLITZER In less than 24 hours, the U.S. 101st Airborne Division has driven Iraqi Fedayeen fighters from the key city of Najaf , pushed north in a several-pronged attack.
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-25" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Army's 3rd Infantry has punched through Karbala , meeting only light resistance from the Medina Republican Guard, and moving along highway nine within 25 miles of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-21" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="KA" type="PPLA"

column1: At the same time, the Marines from the 1st Division have secured a key Tigris River crossing near Al Kut and reported to have essentially destroyed the combat fighting ability of that light infantry Baghdad division that was supposed to be providing defense down there.
column2: Tigris River PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895173" id="Pl-38" latLong="31.000°N 47.417°E" type="WATER",Al Kut PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897407" id="Pl-23" latLong="32.498°N 45.829°E" state="WA" type="PPLA",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: At the U.S. Central Command briefing this morning at the forward headquarters in Doha , Qatar , General Vincent Brooks said that the U.S. would be continuing to approach Baghdad .

column1: Could be the most loyal fighters left as they draw into Baghdad .

column1: For a look at what might lie ahead for U.S. forces, let's turn to our Miles O'Brien in Atlanta .

column1: COL. PAT LANG (RET,), U.S. ARMY You're welcome.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Is it the Republican Guard or is it the U.S. and coalition supply lines?
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: LANG Well, they are close enough up to Baghdad now so that the supply line issue is probably not a big one since they had time to restock, food, fuel and ammunition.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Once they are satisfied they are through all that, I would imaging there will be a pause while they start to reconnoiter into Baghdad , probing hard to see how much resistance there really is.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: One of the next key points along the way here is Saddam international airport . Do you suppose that is a key target right now?
column2: Saddam international airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-274" type="FAC"

column1: And if the front stabilizes between there and the downtown Baghdad , they'll start using it for a fixed wing aircraft as well.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column2: Saddam International Airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-285" type="FAC"

column1: LANG Yeah, these are the high-speed approaches into the heart of the city and armored forces like the 3rd Mechanized Infantry Division just love high-speed approaches.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: They will try to go down those things, cutting the city up into sectors as best they can, and then work on the specific sectors of the city they think are a key terrain.

column2: Chicago PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:424587" id="Pl-30" latLong="41.850°N 87.650°W" state="US-IL" type="PPL"

column1: Tremendous amount of force needed to control a city of that source, or am a wrong?
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: If, in fact, a lot of people in the city don't want to be liberated and you're never going to know that until you try, then you're going to need a much larger force, and we might end up waiting a couple of weeks for reinforcements.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: They rose up, didn't get American support.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Do you suppose it will be a different story in Baghdad ?
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: They have a long history of being kicked around by the Sunni Arab population of central Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It's the other people in the city you have to worry about, who are ethnically much the same as the Saddam Hussein regime.

column1: BLITZER New explosions rock Baghdad after dark.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Witnesses say they heard blasts around a presidential complex in the center of the city . Meantime, the U.S. reportedly has hundreds of troops poised to reinforce the Baghdad international airport , now under the control of American troops.
column2: complex PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-278" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-29" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",international airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-281" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: A source tells CNN's Nic Robertson, some Iraqi Republican Guard forces are gathering close to the airport . Columns of coalition forces keep pressing north and tightening the noose on Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: CNN's Central Command says some 2,500 Republican Guard forces surrendered, that is, between Kut and Baghdad .
column2: Kut PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGB:16897407" id="Pl-30" latLong="32.498°N 45.829°E" state="IQ-WA" type="PPLA",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Now, the latest on the fight for control of Baghdad 's International Airport .
column2: International Airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-263" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",International PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-279" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: While coalition forces say they have secured the facility , that's not the case in the surrounding area.
column2: facility PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-264" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: ITN reporter James Mates was with the U.S. forces when they moved in to secure the airport . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JAMES MATES, ITN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) It was a showpiece of his regime.
column2: airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Now Saddam International Airport is controlled by coalition troops and, tonight, it has a new name, Baghdad International .
column2: International Airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-263" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",Saddam International Airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-266" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",International PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-279" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: These pictures were taken on the runway just moments after the coalition attack.
column2: runway PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-288" state="IQ-BG" type="ROAD"

column1: Wreckage burning in a hangar as U.S. troops rush in.
column2: hangar PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-257" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: At dawn this morning, U.S. tanks and infantry had rolled in to claim their biggest prize of the war so far.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Building by building, they swept the terminal complex , then moved on to secure the runway .
column2: complex PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-278" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",terminal PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-261" predicative="true" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",runway PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-288" state="IQ-BG" type="ROAD"

column1: The fall of his airport is a humiliating blow for Saddam.
column2: airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: It lies SIGNAL id="S-2" just 12 miles SIGNAL from Baghdad and will be a key forward base for U.S. troops as they prepare for a push on the capital . More than 300 Iraqi soldiers have been left dead.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-280" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Some Republican Guard troops fought fiercely on the northern side of the airport complex . UNIDENTIFIED MALE Hopefully, this is a sign that we're able to send to the residents of Baghdad that we're here and they can rise up and deal with the regime appropriately.
column2: complex PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-278" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: MATES Outside the airport , the fighting was fierce, but the battle unequal.
column2: airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Here, the remains of an Iraqi armored car, and by its side the body of an Iraqi soldier, all that remains of a column that pushed up the airport road last night in a final effort to defend the airport . U.S. troops are now knocking on the door of Baghdad .
column2: road PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-282" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But the final push into the city could yet prove to be the toughest fighting of all.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: (on camera): The patchy, somewhat disorganized defense of the airport last night has left coalition commanders with several questions.
column2: airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Have they done so much damage now to Iraqi command and control centers that they can no longer put up a proper fight, or are the best troops simply withdrawing into the city , to fight there street by street?
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The answer to that could well decide how quickly they make a final push into the city . James Mates, ITV News, with the U.S. marines, SIGNAL id="S-1" south SIGNAL of Baghdad . (END VIDEOTAPE)
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraq  Warns of Unconventional Counter Attack Tonight; Saddam Sends
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: BLITZER Attacking on the ground and calling in air strikes, Kurdish fighters and U.S. troops have dislodged stubborn Iraqi soldiers at a key bridge in northern Iraq .
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraqis pulled back on the road to Mosul as CNN's Jane Arraf reports from the battlefield.
column2: ,road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-40" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JANE ARRAF, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) A few miles further to Mosul , Kurdish militia and their flags speeding to a town abandoned by Iraqi forces.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",town PLACE country="IQ" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-39" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: After a day of fighting, the Iraqis were driven back five kilometers, SIGNAL id="S-1" about three miles SIGNAL down the main road SIGNAL id="S-2" west SIGNAL towards Mosul from the Kurdish city of Erbil .
column2: ,road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-40" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Erbil PLACE country="IQ" gazref="IGDB:16893567" id="Pl-37" latLong="36.190°N 44.009°E" state="AR" type="PPLA",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: Soldiers were Kurdish , but the special forces calling in air strikes on Iraqi positions were American .
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: As U.S. warplanes dropped bombs near the town , Kurdish fighters moved forward. (on camera): There's a slow-and-steady battle going on here for control of the key bridge.
column2: ,U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",town PLACE country="IQ" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-39" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: It's a bridge over the river on the main road to Mosul .
column2: ,road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-40" type="ROAD",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA",river PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-41" type="WATER"

column1: The Iraqis are firing artillery like that in response to the Americans are calling in air strikes.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Peshmerga are just down the road, and the Iraqis have retreated, but they're still holding on to the bridge. (voice-over): That blast turned out to be a rocket-propelled grenade, but there's plenty of artillery and mortar fire to come.
column2: ,road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-40" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Are you coming here?
ARRAF Less than 20 minutes later, with Iraqi defenses pounded by the bombing, they no longer held the bridge over the Khoser River .
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Khoser River PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-44" type="WATER"

column1: In this vehicle, the only Iraqi casualties we saw.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Their military radio and guns indicating they were combatants. (on camera): It's still smoldering, this truck with three Iraqi soldiers.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It was either shelled or bombed.
Now, it's a small part of this battle for the bridge just behind us.
These were lying on the ground next to the truck.
Somebody picked them up.
It's an I.D. card, presumably for one of the soldiers.
The only thing you can really tell from it is that he was 27 years old.
And a snapshot from when his life was still ahead of him.
Other evidence of a hurried retreat amid the smoldering vehicles, a discarded gas mask.
Military documents.
Notebooks with verses from the Koran.
Kurdish fighters planted their flag and left it waving in the smoke of the bombed-out Iraqi truck.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The village of Manguba (ph), SIGNAL id="S-3" just 32 kilometers SIGNAL , SIGNAL id="S-4" about 23 miles SIGNAL from Mosul is now in Kurdish hands.
column2: ,Manguba PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16891757" id="Pl-43" latLong="36.300°N 43.567°E" state="NI" type="PPL",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: One Kurdish soldier did the honors of tearing up a poster of Saddam Hussein.
Not just the poster, but the frame and cardboard backing as well.
They've been waiting a long time.
Jane Arraf, CNN, on the bridge over the Khoser River in northern Iraq . (END VIDEO CLIP) BLITZER Thanks very much.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Khoser River PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-44" type="WATER"

column1: Judy, dangerous assignment for all of our reporters, our embedded journalists.
And one of them, not from our CNN, but from a very close friend of all of ours, Michael Kelly, paid that price.
The first American embedded journalist to have gotten killed in covering this war.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We'll have more on him at 5:00 on our special edition of "WOLF BLITZER REPORTS." Until then, thanks, Judy, back to you.
WOODRUFF Thanks, Wolf.
And we'll be watching.

Michael Kelly, of course, with " Atlantic Monthly," and a columnist for the " Washington Post." Well, at least three U.S. service members were killed today in an apparent suicide bomb attack at a checkpoint near the Haditah Dam northwest of Baghdad .
column2: ,Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-46" latLong="38.895°N 77.037°W" state="DC" type="PPLC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Haditah PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16894456" id="Pl-48" latLong="34.140°N 42.378°E" state="AN" type="PPL",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Those deaths are not yet included in the official casualty count.
At last report, though, 41 Americans had been killed by hostile forces, 13 others by friendly fire or in accidents.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Of the 27 British troops, in all who have been killed, at least 19 of them were said to be victims of friendly fire or accidents.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-51" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The official Iraqi casualty figures remain the same this day, including more than 400 civilians killed, Iraqi authorities say.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And U.S. Central Command says more than 4,000 Iraqis have been captured, but British officials believe that figure is much higher.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-51" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We know that seven Americans are known to be held as prisoner of war in Iraq .
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Another 15 Americans listed as missing in action.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Well, funeral services were held today in Colorado for 21-year- old Marine Corporal Randall Kent Rosacker.
column2: ,Colorado PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780779" id="Pl-52" latLong="39.000°N 105.500°W" state="CO" type="CIVIL"

column1: He was killed in action in Iraq .
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: His story is especially poignant.
His father is a navy commander.
He received word of his son's death within hours after the submarine that he was assigned to returned home from an extended deployment.
The Iraqis promise an unconventional attack on U.S. troops tonight.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Do they mean guerilla warfare, as in Vietnam ?
column2: ,Vietnam PLACE country="VN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16266660" id="Pl-53" latLong="16.167°N 107.833°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We're going to ask our military analyst.
That's coming up.
Coalition Troops Penetrate Outskirts of Baghdad
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Well, as coalition forces push ahead in their bid to capture Baghdad , big questions remain about Saddam Hussein and his whereabouts.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: It is still not clear, looking at the latest tapes of the Iraqi president, whether he's dead or alive.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CNN senior international correspondent Nic Robertson, who was expelled from Baghdad , is with us now from the border of Iraq and Jordan , on the Jordanian side, to talk about what's happening in the Iraqi capital . Nic, we're getting information in bits and pieces about the incursion by coalition land forces, about air flights over the city . Help us pull it all together.

column1: NIC ROBERTSON, CNN SENIOR INTERNATIONAL CORRESPONDENT Well, from what we hear from sources in Baghdad this evening, it had been mostly quiet in terms of bombing throughout the day in Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Then there was a large explosion not far from the hotel journalists are staying in in the center of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: What we're hearing from Iraqi people in the capital today is that they know and they have seen coalition forces in the southwest of the city , in the southeast of the city .
column2: capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-43" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: They say they have also seen coalition forces and believe coalition forces have a checkpoint on the northern outskirts of Baghdad as well.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: So as far as the Iraqi people are concerned, they are very aware that coalition forces are right on the perimeter of the city . Our sources are also telling us that Iraqi forces are massing artillery pieces and tanks at a number of locations on the southwestern edge of the city .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-43" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: These locations, actually, very close to the center of Baghdad and appear to be forming something sort of front line against the coalition forces.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Now, Iraq 's minister of information today said that the coalition did not have control of the airport, that this was some sort of contrived video from the first day, and that, in fact, hundreds of coalition soldiers had been killed, and their graves were now at the airport.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The information minister also read a statement from President Saddam Hussein today, the Iraqi leader calling on people to be resolute, to be strong, and saying that if they put up a good fight, then the coalition would eventually back down. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) MOHAMMED SAEED AL-SAHAF, IRAQI INFORMATION MINISTER (through translator) But to harm the enemy more and more, go against the enemy and destroy the enemy and follow the plans that you got in writing.
column2: IRAQI PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: (END VIDEO CLIP) ROBERTSON Now, representatives of the committee -- the International Committee for the Red Cross, who have been to some of the hospitals in Baghdad , report higher-than-usual numbers of casualties coming into those hospitals.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: And Iraqi officials promise to take journalists to this particular hospital, the Yarmuk Hospital, that is now located, it's on the southwest of Baghdad , and it appears to be pretty much between the position of where coalition forces have been seen and where Iraq now has a militarized front-line position.

column1: Tim Ewart of ITN News reports on evidence of atrocities at an abandoned Iraqi military base . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) TIM EWART, ITV NEWS (voice-over) It was a discovery that horrified the soldiers who made it.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The remains of hundreds of men were found in plastic bags and Unsealed hard-board coffins.
British troops found the bodies at an abandoned Iraqi military base on the outskirts of Azubayr .
column2: ,Azubayr PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16887301" id="Pl-11" latLong="31.183°N 46.117°E" state="IQ-DQ",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-9" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The evidence suggested it was the scene of appalling atrocities.
The teeth in many of the skulls had been broken, and bones appeared to be wrapped in strips of military uniform.
It's not clear how long the bodies had lain here, but they were clearly not from this war.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE You come to expect everything in war fighting.
The coffins were there.
It was a bit more of a surprise when I discovered the bags with the human remains inside.
EWART Inside a neighboring building , there was evidence of cells and a catalog of photographs of the dead.
Most had died from gunshot wounds to the head.
Others were mutilated beyond recognition, their faces burned and swollen.
Outside, soldiers discovered what they described as a purpose- built shooting gallery , the brickwork behind it riddled with bullets.
Identity cards revealed the names of some of the dead.
Forensic specialists will now visit the scene and hope to establish the truth of what happened here and when.
(on camera): Today's discovery seems to provide shocking evidence of atrocities under Saddam Hussein's regime.
Most people are afraid to talk openly about what's been happening here.
But when they do, British soldiers believe, more horrors will come to light.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-9" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Tim Ewart, ITV News, Azubayr . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Well, from a gruesome finding to a dangerous one in central Iraq .

column1: In a CNN exclusive, CNN's Kyra Phillips offers us a ride-along over the city of Baghdad with some airborne bodyguards.

column1: War in Iraq
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: An apparent friendly fire incident in northern Iraq is taking more of a toll on Kurdish leaders than we knew at first.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And there are late reports that the 45 wounded include the brother and a son of a Kurdish political leader.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL"

column1: Julian Manyon of ITN has more from Northern Iraq . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JULIAN MANYON, ITN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) It is another friendly fire disaster.
column2: Northern Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-3" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This morning, an American bomb destroyed a convoy carrying high officials of the Kurdish Peshmerga forces, which have been fighting alongside the Americans on the northern front.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL",American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: At least 17 Kurdish commanders and their guards were killed, along with an interpreter working for the BBC.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL"

column1: The military chief of the Kurdish KDP, the brother of their leader, Massud Barzani (ph), was gravely hurt. (on camera): Trying to organize a northern front with just a few hundred U.S. Special Forces troops and the poorly armed Kurdish Peshmerga guerrillas was always going to be a high-risk exercise.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-15" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The idea was to open the way with heavy sustained American bombing of Iraqi positions.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But today, it all went disastrously wrong. (voice-over): Even as we filmed the wreckage, U.S. jets were still dropping their bombs nearby.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-15" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Giant explosions erupted down the road . Earlier, we had joined another convoy of U.S. Special Forces troops and Kurdish fighters as they tried to move south through country abandoned by the Iraqi army.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-15" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: American troops controlled the operation from a rooftop.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Then, as the Kurds advanced again, the Iraqis opened up. (on camera): Now we're hearing the boom of Iraqi guns as they fire towards our positions.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: All morning, the Kurds have been trying to advance, and that was the shell going off. (voice-over): The Iraqi gunners rapidly found our range, and we took refuge in an abandoned farm house . UNIDENTIFIED MALE Get down.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Here in the north, Iraqi tanks and guns are still firing, and the American effort is looking a little ragged.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Julian Manyon, ITV News, on the northern front. (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Julian Manyon with some very dramatic pictures as we look at the live pictures of Baghdad at night.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: American  Troops Capture Saddam Hussein's Main Palace
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-1" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But it is being rediscovered by U.S. troops in Iraq , at least some of them.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Karl Penhaul is with an Army attack helicopter battalion in the town of Najaf in southeastern Iraq . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KARL PENHAUL, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) War, soldiers say, is long hours of boredom, followed by a few moments of madness.
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-12" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Melony Marshall was married just a month before she left for Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: PFC MELONY MARSHALL, U.S. ARMY "Hi, sweetheart.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CWO JOHN DAVIS, U.S. ARMY "Dear Keegan (ph), Britney (ph) and Josh (ph), I'm doing fine, as is the rest of the battalion.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: PFC TIFFANY O'NEAL, U.S. ARMY "Hey, Ashley (ph), how you doing?
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: JOE BRUHL, U.S. ARMY "In my previous letter, written less than two days removed, I only wanted to convey my safety.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: PENHAUL (on camera) Different ranks, different anxieties, but all are hoping, by the time their letters get back to the U.S. , they too will soon be heading home.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Karl Penhaul, for CNN, An Najaf , Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Very poignant.
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-12" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",An Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-13" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And, as we listened to John King's report, we can tell you that President Bush has just -- his plane has just landed at Andrews Air Force Base , just SIGNAL id="S-1" close to SIGNAL the Washington area, the president having flown back to the United States from that meeting in Northern Ireland in Belfast with the British prime minister, Tony Blair.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" type="COUNTRY", ,Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-1" latLong="38.895°N 77.037°W" state="US-DC" type="RGN",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-6" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Belfast PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17410393" id="Pl-4" latLong="54.583°N 5.933°W" state="GB-NIR" type="PPLA",Northern Ireland PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17395725" id="Pl-13" latLong="54.500°N 6.500°W" state="GB-NIR" type="CIVIL"

column1: You just heard John reporting about it.
They primarily talked about the war in Iraq , the aftermath of Iraq .
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But they also discussed the Middle East and, as well, getting the Northern Ireland peace process started up again.
column2: ,Northern Ireland PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17395725" id="Pl-13" latLong="54.500°N 6.500°W" state="GB-NIR" type="CIVIL"

column1: It has been said that Saddam Hussein ruled Iraq with an iron fist.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: I guess you can say in the past tense.
His regime has left behind some disturbing evidence to support those claims.
The abandoned secret police headquarters in Basra is just one example.
column2: ,Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-18" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: ITN's Bill Neely is with the Royal Marines and he takes us on a tour of Basra 's chamber of horrors . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) BILL NEELY, ITN REPORTER (voice-over) Saddam Hussein's Iraq is a state of terror, and this is where it's planned and perpetrated, the headquarters of his secret police, this one in Basra .
column2: ,chamber of horrors PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-387" state="IQ-BA" type="FAC",Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-18" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: No British soldier has been here yet.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-6" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Today, as I walked in, I met Iraqis, none of whom had ever been inside willingly.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: What was to follow was a horrific education in terror and torture: in the smoking basement of the bombed building , a warren of cells.
Here, prisoners were tortured.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Yes, of course.
NEELY People died.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE People died, people in prison without court, without trial.
NEELY Any people who Saddam did not like.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Of course.
Of course.
NEELY (voice-over) The building is crumbling.
Down we went, further to cells that had no light, little air, cockroaches, filth, and, on the ground, a gas mask and bottles of chemicals.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE You can imagine this every day, every month.
So many people come here, but we don't know about them at all.
NEELY These ordinary Iraqis had been terrified to come here, until today, though one student on the left had been here before.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE He was one of the prisoners here. (on camera): For how long?
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Eight years.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Eight, nine, eight years.
NEELY (voice-over) And his crime for eight years in jail?
He prayed too much and was seen as a dangerous radical. (on camera): More cells. (voice-over): But the Mukhabarat headquarters had more horrors to reveal.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE And they tied their hands behind and hung them and hung them for many days.
NEELY These men had relatives murdered here.
So desperate are they to tell their story that they began reenacting what they and their brothers and friends have suffered.
The hook in the ceiling is for one purpose only, another hook in a different cell and a different form of torture.
Saddam Hussein controlled Iraq through fear, torture and execution.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And it happened here to tens of thousands of Iraqis that Saddam's secret police deemed dangerous.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This man cowered for months, crammed with 300 mothers into a huge cell.
Hamid Fatil (ph) may look like he's acting, but he was tortured here, along with his two brothers, who were executed.
This man was here, too, with his brother.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE They sentenced him to death.
And they sent him to Baghdad and killed.
column2: ,Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: He was hanged there, hanged.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE There's a prisoner under the name of Ahmed Adis Aeid (ph).

NEELY They kept records of prisoners, these and their fingerprints all that's left of them, apart from the photographs they took of exactly what they had done. (on camera): If there is an evil center to Saddam Hussein's regime, then it is surely here and in other places of torture.
And there's plenty here that we simply cannot show you.
In this block , it was men over here, hundreds of them, and women and children here. (voice-over): To call all this a chamber of horrors is a cliche.
column2: ,chamber of horrors PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-387" state="IQ-BA" type="FAC"

column1: And this place is beyond cliche.
The hundreds or thousands who died here who were given no trial, no voice, cry out.
On the ground, I found a book called "The Psychology of Interrogation," as if the men who worked here for Saddam needed a handbook.
I was glad of the fresh air and glad to leave, glad I could.
No one knows yet whether the new Iraq will be the kind of place where these children can grow up free of the fear, the horror of torture.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Bill Neely, ITV News, Basra . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Unspeakable.
column2: ,Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-18" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: Journalists killed in the line of duty in Baghdad -- how neutral are reporters in a war supposed to be?
column2: ,Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Our Jeff Greenfield examines that question when we come back.
Well, the journalists' death raise questions about the tactics of U.S. troops trying to take control of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" type="COUNTRY"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JEFF GREENFIELD, CNN SR. ANALYST (voice-over) When an Al- Jazeera reporter was killed today, the network charged it had been targeted by U.S. force.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" type="COUNTRY"

column1: At a nearby hotel, two other journalists, a photographer from Reuters and another from Tele 5 Spain died, another case, CENTCOM says, of coalition forces returning fire.
column2: Spain PLACE country="ES" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19596523" id="Pl-15" latLong="40.000°N 4.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: A Kurdish journalist died in a U.S. friendly-fire accident in the north .

column1: And an American writer editor, " Washington Post" editorial columnist Michael Kelly, was killed when his Humvee plunged into a canal while evading Iraqi fire.
